title: 113_hr1868
content: Section 304 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to allow for permissible revisions of budget resolutions. This amendment gives the two Houses and the President the ability to enact a joint resolution on the budget that revises or reaffirms the previously enacted budget resolution for the fiscal year. Additionally, the chairman of the Budget Committee of the House of Representatives or the Senate can adjust levels as needed for budget resolution enforcement. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON THE CONTENT OF BUDGET RESOLUTIONS. It restricts the inclusion of certain matters in budget resolutions, amendments, or conference reports in the House of Representatives or the Senate. SEC. 7 introduces an automatic standing order upon veto of a joint resolution on the budget, making it enforceable within 15 days of presentment to the President. SEC. 8 introduces additional amendments to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to effectuate joint resolutions on the budget. Additional amendments to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 include changing "concurrent" to "joint" in various sections, replacing "concurrent resolution" with "joint resolution," and updating terminology from "agreed to" to "enacted." The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to change "concurrent" to "joint" in various sections and update terminology to "enacted." The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to change "concurrent" to "joint" in various sections of the Rules of the House of Representatives and the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985.
